author: 滇西小哥 Dianxi Xiaoge
description:
※Click "cc" on the lower right menu to choose your subtitle language.

This spring, I cleared a small patch of land behind the house and set up a trellis to plant a chayote — locally we call it “yang si gua.” It’s an incredibly productive vegetable, with a fruiting season that lasts nearly four months. One family can’t possibly finish it all, so neighbors often come by to pick some, and the overripe or bug-bitten ones are simply fed to the pigs.
The flesh can be tender and crisp, or soft and sweet when cooked. With just one chayote, you can make a whole table of dishes — steamed, stir-fried, stewed, or mixed cold — and every way tastes delicious.

Hello, everyone! I am Dianxi Xiaoge, a Yunnan native. If you enjoy my videos, please keep subscribing to my channel. I'll continue to share my life and Yunnan-styled food in my uploads. Wish you have a happy life and enjoy tasty food every day

title: Chayote — You reap what you sow; one plant feeds the whole village…【滇西小哥】
